intro: Chamaecrista anfracta, commonly known as the zigzag crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-bearing fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are clustered in dense, branched inflorescences, and it produces slender, twisted seed pods. Chamaecrista anfracta is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
